definition: scissors/shears/clippers/CL:把[ba3]/to cut with scissors/to trim/to wipe out or exterminate

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: In the same year, the territory's first public indoor garden show in the opening scissors Lane.
sentences.chinese: 同年，境內第一座公共室內戲園在剪子巷開業。

sentences.english: My mother and I get the basket into the orchard and the scissors.
sentences.chinese: 我和媽媽領取提籃和剪子進入果園。

sentences.english: They cut what locks there were with scissors.
sentences.chinese: 他們用剪子絞下隨手抓住的一絡絡頭髮。

sentences.english: Drain in a colander and, using kitchen scissors, cut into 6-inch lengths.
sentences.chinese: 用簸篩濾水後，用廚用剪子剪成6英寸長。

sentences.english: He was cutting apart aluminum pans with a pair of shears.
sentences.chinese: 他正在用一把大剪子剪開鋁製平底鍋。

sentences.english: Charlie asked as he grabbed a pair of scissors and started snipping off the heads of the grain in the grain field.
sentences.chinese: 查理邊拿着剪子修剪着田裏的穀物邊問。

sentences.english: I need you to keep him away from sharp objects-knives, scissors.
sentences.chinese: 你不能讓他拿到尖利的東西刀剪子。

sentences.english: Elisa took off her gloves and stuffed them in the apron pocket with the scissors.
sentences.chinese: 伊利莎脫下手套，把它們放在裝着剪子的圍裙口袋裏。

sentences.english: To cut this knot, you need a knife or a pair of scissors.
sentences.chinese: 要剪斷這個繩結，需要一把小刀或者一個剪子。

definition: a saw/to cut with a saw
